data.Name: Rachel Nemeth Cohen
data.staff_bio: Rachel Nemeth Cohen is an Education Specialist at the Institute for Community Inclusion and a member of the School and Community Projects team. Her work focuses on alternate assessment and transition from school to adult life for students labeled with significant cognitive disabilities. Rachel is currently working on the Massachusetts Comprehensive Assessment System Alternate Assessment (MCAS-Alt) with the Massachusetts Department of Education, where she provides statewide training and technical assistance to teachers to prepare alternate assessment portfolios that meet the stateâ€™s requirements for testing all students. Activities include providing large trainings to educators, follow-up technical assistance to school districts, development of training materials, and oversight of the Scoring Institute for MCAS-Alt where the portfolios are scored. In addition, Rachel has taught a variety of college-level classes and seminars on transition from school to adult life. These classes assisted educators to apply promising and inclusive practices in transition planning, including person-centered planning, career development, and pertinent laws related to transition. Rachel has worked in a number of community and school settings to support individuals with disabilities for over 15 years.
